sen.j: 大親寺（だいしんじ）は奈良県天理市滝本町にある仏教寺院である。
sen.e: Daishin-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple located in Takimoto-cho, Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.
Daishin-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple located in Takimoto-cho, Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.
Daishin-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple located in Takimoto-cho, Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.
Sango is Yamato Momoosan.
The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Yamato Momoosan.
sen.cmt: 山号の説明文を入れました。
sen.e: The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Yamato Momoosan.

sen.j: 本尊は釈迦如来（しゃかむにぶつ）。
sen.e: The principal image is Shaka Nyorai (Shakamuni butsu).
The principal image of Buddha is Shaka Nyorai (Shakamuni butsu).
The principal image of Buddha is Shaka Nyorai (Shakamuni butsu).

sen.j: 明治の廃仏毀釈令まで、真言宗の桃尾山蓮華王院龍福寺（ももおさんれんげおういんりゅうふくじ）であった。
sen.e: This temple used to be Momoosan Rengeoin Ryufuku-ji Temple of Shingon sect until the prohibition order of Buddhism in the Meiji period.
This temple used to be called Momoosan Rengeoin Ryufuku-ji Temple and belong to the Shingon sect until the prohibition order of Buddhism in the Meiji period.
This temple used to be called Momoosan Rengeoin Ryufuku-ji Temple and belong to the Shingon sect until the prohibition order of Buddhism in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 寺伝によると和銅年中に、義淵により開基。
sen.e: According to the temple legend, this temple was founded by Gien in Wado era.
According to the temple legend, this temple was founded by Gien in the Wado era.
According to the temple legend, this temple was founded by Gien in the Wado era.

sen.j: その後、行基が伽藍を整備したと伝える。
sen.e: Then, Gyoki is said to have maintained the temple buildings.
The temple buildings are said to have been maintained by Gyoki thereafter.
sen.cmt: 受動形にした方が試験に聞こえます。
sen.e: The temple buildings are said to have been maintained by Gyoki thereafter.

sen.j: そして、空海が再興し、真言密教の道場となり、真言宗桃尾山蓮華王院龍福寺と号した。
sen.e: Later, when restored by Kukai, it became an ascetic exercise hall for Shingon Esoteric Buddhism, and was called Shingon sect Momoosan Rengeoin Ryufuku-ji Temple.
Later, when restored by Kukai, it became an ascetic exercise hall for Shingon Esoteric Buddhism, and was called Momoosan Rengeoin Ryufuku-ji Temple of the Shingon sect.
sen.cmt: Shingon Sectを最後の方に移しました。
sen.e: Later, when restored by Kukai, it became an ascetic exercise hall for Shingon Esoteric Buddhism, and was called Momoosan Rengeoin Ryufuku-ji Temple of the Shingon sect.

sen.j: 最盛期には寺領100石、16坊舎を有する大伽藍となるが、1868年（慶応4年）閏4月15日廃仏毀釈令により一旦断絶する。
sen.e: Although at the height of its prosperity, it became a large Buddhist temple posessing temple estate 100-koku, and 16 priest houses, it was temporarily broken down due to the prohibition order of Buddhism on April 15, 1868.

Although at the height of its prosperity, it became a large Buddhist temple possessing 100-koku (a measure of wealth based on rice), and 16 priest houses, operations were temporarily ceased due to the prohibition order of Buddhism on April 15, 1868.
sen.cmt: 石の説明文を挿入し、broken dwon >operations were ceased.
sen.e: Although at the height of its prosperity, it became a large Buddhist temple possessing 100-koku (a measure of wealth based on rice), and 16 priest houses, operations were temporarily ceased due to the prohibition order of Buddhism on April 15, 1868.

sen.j: その後、行基作の石仏、不動明王像の霊験があり、大正7年7月、龍福寺の阿弥陀堂跡地に不動堂を建立し、大和桃尾山大親寺と号す。
sen.e: Later on, following a miraculous efficacy of the statue of Fudo Myoo, which was a stone statue made by Gyoki, they constructed a Fodo-do hall on the former site of the Amida-do hall in Ryufuku-ji Temple and renamed the temple Yamato Momoosan Daishin-ji Temple in July 1918.

Later on, following a miracle involving the statue of Fudo Myoo, a stone statue made by Gyoki, in July 1918 they constructed a Fodo-do hall on the former site of the Amida-do hall in Ryufuku-ji Temple and renamed the temple Yamato Momoosan Daishin-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: miraculous efficacy>miracle involving. which wasを省略し、順番を変えました。
sen.e: Later on, following a miracle involving the statue of Fudo Myoo, a stone statue made by Gyoki, in July 1918 they constructed a Fodo-do hall on the former site of the Amida-do hall in Ryufuku-ji Temple and renamed the temple Yamato Momoosan Daishin-ji Temple.

sen.j: 後、昭和36年に、現在の本堂を建立する。
sen.e: After that, present-day main hall was constructed in 1961.
After that, present-day main hall was constructed in 1961.
After that, present-day main hall was constructed in 1961.

sen.j: 不動明王の石仏－山道途中。
sen.e: Stone statue of Fudo-Myoo - on the way to the mountain.
Stone statue of Fudo-Myoo - on the mountain road.
Stone statue of Fudo-Myoo - on the mountain road.

sen.j: 地蔵菩薩の石仏－山道途中。
sen.e: Stone statue of Zizo Bosatsu - on the way to the mountain.
Stone statue of Zizo Bosatsu - on the mountain road.
Stone statue of Zizo Bosatsu - on the mountain road.

sen.j: 弁財天女の石仏－山頂途中。
sen.e: Stone statue of Benzaitennyo - on the way to the top of the mountain.
Stone statue of Benzaitennyo - on the way to the mountain peak.
Stone statue of Benzaitennyo - on the way to the mountain peak.

sen.j: 不動明王の石仏－行基菩薩作。

sen.j: 大親寺の祠－桃尾山（国見山）山頂。
sen.e: Small shrine of Daishin-ji Temple - on the top of Mt. Momoo (Mt. Kunimi).
Small shrine of Daishin-ji Temple - on the top of Mt. Momoo (Mt. Kunimi).
Small shrine of Daishin-ji Temple - on the top of Mt. Momoo (Mt. Kunimi).

sen.j: 御山大神－磐座の中心に「御山大神」と刻まれている。
sen.e: Onyama no Okami - the letters '御山大神' are inscribed in the center of the Iwakura (dwelling place of a god, usually in reference to a large rock).
Onyama no Okami - the letters '御山大神' (the God's name) are inscribed in the center of the Iwakura (dwelling place of a god, usually in reference to a large rock).
sen.cmt: 御山大神の説明文を挿入しました。
sen.e: Onyama no Okami - the letters '御山大神' (the God's name) are inscribed in the center of the Iwakura (dwelling place of a god, usually in reference to a large rock).

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道桜井線・近鉄天理線 - 天理駅から奈良交通バスで上滝本バス停下車後、山道徒歩20分。
sen.e: Take JR Sakurai line or Kintetsu Tenri line and get off at Tenri Station, take Nara Kotsu bus and get off at Kamitakimoto, then walk on the mountain path for 20 minutes.
